Key Match Events: Zimbabwe reduced India to 28 for four in the Powerplay and eventually bowled them out for 102 in 19.5 overs.
Zimbabwe spinner Wellington Masakadza finished with figures of 1/15 in three overs.
Pakistan-born Sikandar Raza was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for taking three wickets and scoring 17 runs.
Pre-Game Insights: Zimbabwe spinner Wellington Masakadza mentioned that the team will exploit the home conditions to the maximum to win the five-match series.
Masakadza highlighted the challenge of facing Indian spinners Ravi Bishnoi and Washington Sundar, who have performed well in the IPL.
Post-Match Reflections: Masakadza expressed that a series win would be a significant boost for Zimbabwe cricket, which has been on the decline for several years.
Masakadza mentioned that the series is a new chapter for Zimbabwe cricket with a new coaching staff.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Harare's winter season and the slowish pitch with a bit of turn were mentioned as factors that could trouble the Indian batters.
Masakadza expressed his desire to play in the IPL, similar to his skipper Sikandar Raza, who played for Punjab Kings this IPL season.
